p: HCoV-OC43 remains incessantly one of the most important etiological factors for respiratory tract diseases in humans. Recently, it was found that HCoV-OC43 employs caveolin-1 dependent endocytosis for the entry [158]. Subsequently, cholesterol-binding or depleting agents such as nystatin ( 104, Fig. 13) or methyl-β-cyclodextrin (MβCD) ( 105, Fig. 13) were reported to inhibit the virus replication via an aveolin-1 caveolin-1 dependent endocytosis entry.
